DEFINITIONS (§ 29-5099) When used in this chapter, the following terms and conditions shall have theollowing meanings: Activities of Daily Living – The ability to bathe, transfer, dress, eatnd feed self, engage in toileting, and maintain bowel and bladder controlcontinence). Advanced Practice Registered Nurse – A person who is licensed oruthorized to practice as an advanced practice registered nurse pursuant to theistrict of Columbia Health Occupations Revision Act of 1985, effective March5, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-99; D.C. Official Code §§ 3-1201 et seq. (2007 Repl.#038; 2012 Supp.)). Authorized representative – Any person other than a provider:
(a) Who is knowledgeable about a resident’s circumstances and has beenesignated by that resident to represent him or her; or
(b) Who is legally authorized either to administer a resident’s financialr personal affairs or to protect and advocate for a resident’s rights.
Department of Health Care Finance – The executive agency of the governmentesponsible for administering the Medicaid program within the District ofolumbia, effective October 1, 2008. Family – Any person related to the client or beneficiary by blood,arriage, or adoption. Order – A formal, written instruction signed by a physician or advancedractice R.N. regarding a specific patient’s medical care, treatment oranagement. An order for PCA services may only be written by a physician inccordance with § 5006.1. PCA Service Authorization Form – A form that has been developed or approved byHCF that identifies the amount, duration and scope of PCA services and theumber of hours authorized based upon a face-to-face assessment in accordanceith § 5003. Primary care physician – A person who is licensed or authorized toractice medicine pursuant to the District of Columbia Health Occupationsevision Act of 1985, effective March 25, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-99; D.C. Officialode §§ 3-1201 et seq. (2007 Repl. & 2012 Supp.)). Registered Nurse – A person who is licensed or authorized to practiceegistered nursing pursuant to the District of Columbia Health Occupationsevision Act of 1985, effective March 25, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-99; D.C. Officialode §§ 3-1201 et seq. (2007 Repl. & 2012 Supp.)). Staffing Agency – Shall have the same meaning as set forth in the Nursetaffing Agency Act of 2003, effective March 10, 2004 (D.C. Law 15-74, D.C.fficial Code § 44-1051.01 et seq.). Start of Care – The first date upon which a beneficiary receives or ischeduled to receive PCA services.
